item.title: Bank Help
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDarkSouls ProjectDarkSouls
item.description:
@ProjectDarkSouls wrote:

Hey man,

A lot were set to true such as bank tabs ect, I have added everything to false,

In the hope at least something will happen.

So I thought instead of looking at the server-side related things to stir into the direction of client-side RsInterface & ClickingButtons.

Here is RsInterface

public static void configureBank(RSFont[] TDA) { RSInterface Tab = addTabInterface(23000); addText(23003, "", TDA, 0, 0xFFB000); addHover(23004, 3, 0, 23005, 3, "Interfaces/Equipment/CHAR", 21, 21, "Close"); addHovered(23005, 2, "Interfaces/Equipment/CHAR", 21, 21, 23006); addHover(23007, 4, 0, 23008, 5, "Interfaces/Bank/BANK", 35, 25, "Deposit carried items"); addHovered(23008, 6, "Interfaces/Bank/BANK", 35, 25, 23009); //addText(19999, "Combat Level: ", TDA, 0, 0xFF981F);

Read full topic

item.title: Bank Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ProjectDarkSouls, post:5, topic:549764”]Was set to false as default.

I’ve messed about in ClickingButtons.java and changed the code, maybe now once it has been reset to ‘false’ it might work.[/quote]
Regardless of it being “set to false by default”, something is setting it to true.
If you have an IDE, which I know you do since you PM’d me, use your IDE to do a search for the variable bankCheck.
If you’re using eclipse, put your cursor on the variable, and then hit ctrl + H. It’ll bring up a file search window and allow you to customize the search. The default should be fine, though.
After you run it it’ll list all the files that it’s in. You get to now go through them all and find the one(s) that set the boolean to true.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ProjectDarkSouls wrote:

Was set to false as default.

I’ve messed about in ClickingButtons.java and changed the code, maybe now once it has been reset to ‘false’ it might work.

item.title: Bank Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It can be that simple.

I did make a mistake though…

The code you provided checks if the boolean “bankCheck” is true.
if it is true, then it says you cannot open the bank.

So make sure it’s set to false.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank Help
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDarkSouls ProjectDarkSouls
item.description:
@ProjectDarkSouls wrote:

It can’t be that simple.

But no, I set it to true and it is still not working.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Fine the code that opens the bank (Example: look for 2213 in the actionhandler)
and make it set the boolean “bankCheck” to true.
It’s that simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank Help
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDarkSouls ProjectDarkSouls
item.description:
@ProjectDarkSouls wrote:

When somebody uses the bank booth they cannot press any of the tabs without an error popping saying “Please go to a bank to do this”

So you cannot deposit all inventory items, summoning items or worn inventory items.

Here is the code;

if(c.bankCheck){
c.sendMessage(“Go to a bank to bank items!”);
c.getPA().closeAllWindows();
return false;
}

Read full topic
